website_summaries.verdict: For those who prefer traditional hard wired phones to modern wireless systems, this is the two-line office phone worth considering. We recommend this model as an upgrade from entry-level office phones but still compatible with older copper wire phones.
pros: Full duplex speakerphone, meaning both parties can hear each other simultaneously
Very professional aesthetics, with traditional copper hard wiring
Display options include English, French and Spanish
cons: Phone service depends on a constant AC power supply
Buttons and controls have been described as confusing, and some users say they start sticking over time
Black plastic shell difficult to keep clean

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: Good phone. Speaker and microphone are surprisingly good. I use it for my business and as long as I don't wander around too much, it works fine. My cheap headset was useless, so I bought a Voistek Call Center one for $30 and it also is fine for business calls. I only use the most basic functions so I can't comment on how well it handles multiple lines, storing numbers, voice mail (do people still use VM) or anything else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cecere

customer_reviews.title: RCA 21521|4
customer_reviews.text: The telephone in general is good but I found a little complicated to set date, hour and telephone numbers I use frequently. Apart from that I would reccomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen A. De Maron

customer_reviews.title: Speaker phone is so bad, I stopped using this after a week
customer_reviews.text: Speaker phone is so bad, I stopped using this after a week. the microphone is literally under solid plastic... they needed to drill out a hole so sound could reach the microphone. Worst phone ever for work purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had this phone about a month and it was fine but right after the period I could return it ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this phone about a month and it was fine but right after the period I could return it the Speaker does not work. Poorly made and very disappointed since I had a RCA phone for 5 year prior.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan  R.  Dzurka

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the few landline phones I've found ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few landline phones I've found with decent audio quality and full-duplex speakerphone audio. I gave 4 stars only because the handset cable is too short and the handset itself is small and slippery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not so durable
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one of these that I have had. They do the job, they just aren't as durable as I would like. I got about 5 years usage out of this.
customer_reviews.author: David Luther Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Working very nicely for me in my office
customer_reviews.text: Working very nicely for me in my office. They are very attractive and a great value. Speakerphones work well too. I have three. It is strictly a hardline system, so no signals trying to reach it causing lots of radio frequency in your environment. There is a model that does adapt to cordless phones, which looks identical. I however didn't want that.
customer_reviews.author: cheri

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this phone!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after three months, the speaker didn't work then the sound on the head piece didn't work and no one could hear you speaking. The angle that the buttons are put on the phone make it hard to dial!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kester

customer_reviews.title: Phone is good overall. Takes some getting used to
customer_reviews.text: Phone is good overall. Takes some getting used to. When you switch from one line to the other it automatically puts the other on hold, even if it's just dial tone.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but when the phone is on speakerphone, everyone complains they can't hear me.
customer_reviews.author: BSM988

customer_reviews.title: So far so good..
customer_reviews.text: So far so good... Really cute... Screen is small but no big deal... People complain about it being dark when the backlight goes out but you can simply hit the exit button or any button and wallah... let there be light... a really nice blue light :D
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Has many great features. Really easy to customize and set up
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a home office in June. Has many great features. Really easy to customize and set up. Directions are easy to read and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Garshock

customer_reviews.title: Phone works fine, unless you have to dial an extension
customer_reviews.text: Phone works fine, unless you have to dial an extension. For some unknown reason the buttons dial fine, when you have to dial an extension it never connects. Rendered useless as a business phone
customer_reviews.author: adam wheatley

customer_reviews.title: Defective mic
customer_reviews.text: There were a lot of things I really liked about this phone, however, people could barely hear me when I was on speakerphone (unless I was leaning close over the phone) or when I plugged in a 2.5mm headset. The only way people could hear me was if I held the handset. Returned and back on the hunt for a different phone.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth D. Terhune

customer_reviews.title: Just got this to replace a crappy ATT phone
customer_reviews.text: Just got this to replace a crappy ATT phone. This is much better. Great design and quality. Steer clear of the cheap ATT phones. This one works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Pratt

customer_reviews.title: The volume is extremely loud even when on a low ...
customer_reviews.text: The volume is extremely loud even when on a low setting. I have to hold phone away from my ear.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Fairfield

customer_reviews.title: It works fine, just no volume control to change it on ...
customer_reviews.text: It works fine, just no volume control to change it on the heatset. It is a little loud on the dialtone and dialing but when talking the volume is good.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: number buttons do not always take when first touched requiring additional attempts
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with power cord. No outlet for headphone jack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, yes - it has full duplex speaker phone
customer_reviews.text: One of few phones which offer real (not great) full duplex speaker phone. Good for home office.
customer_reviews.author: Remo

customer_reviews.title: There is a dial lag when pressing the number.
customer_reviews.text: There is a dial lag when pressing the number .
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive 2-line speaker phone. It's well made and feels solid, not cheap. Would recommend to anyone looking for such a phone.
customer_reviews.author: X3 for me

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Us
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised, plus it looks cool. It's nice having a real office phone, makes me feel like a big boy. Plus it looks cool! What more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone! Only thing is the button need to ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone ! Only thing is the button need to be a little more sensitive !! Otherwise no problems ! Thanks .Again ! Ron Utley
customer_reviews.author: Ron Utley

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It only lasted a month. Not worth the money spent
customer_reviews.author: Rahim Mehdizadeh

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had only a couple of months numbers already wearing wearing out on key pad
customer_reviews.author: anthony caravella

customer_reviews.title: Good Office phone
customer_reviews.text: The phone is good for an small office or single desk. It has big numbers and high volume for the ring tone
customer_reviews.author: LCantu

customer_reviews.title: Don't make them like they use to.
customer_reviews.text: My old RCA desk phone died and this one not everything the old one was. The tone of the number will make a call but automated prompts will not recognize number selection because the tones are so short. And I can save a CID number to the directory but not to the memory buttons! You have to manually enter them. It is better then the Panasonic i used shortly before this one it drove me nuts because the CID could not be browsed while your were on the phone well at least this RCA can that drove me crazy.
customer_reviews.author: E. Zaborac

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The item was great. It works wonderfully. It's just what I needed. Great seller. Speedy shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Karen C.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: Speaker sound is weak and full of static. The caller can hear sound but not the person on the other end cannot hear the caller communicate. Dial tones lag. Horrible!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Flaherty

customer_reviews.title: RCA Phone
customer_reviews.text: Phone does everything I want it to do. I am using it in a home office. Old cordless phone was interfering with my wireless router. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Uricchio

customer_reviews.title: El Cheapo Phone, Buy the AT&T ML17929 Instead
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this phone because it said it was a full duplex speakerphone. However, the headset jack did not work and the sound quality on the speakerphone was horrible. I ordered the AT&T ML17929 to replace it and it is great. I don't think it is a full duplex speakerphone, so I will use the mute and headset when needed to manage. It is also $20 cheaper than this cheapo RCA phone. If you don't need full duplex on the speaker phone, save some money and get a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey King

customer_reviews.title: Phone Review
customer_reviews.text: Good quality phone with all the features I wanted. Good vocal quality and easy to set up. Really fast delivery. I ordered the phone early Monday morning, it arrived Tuesday afternoon with regular shipping!
customer_reviews.author: JohnD

customer_reviews.title: wrong phones
customer_reviews.text: These phones look great and have a lot of bells and whistles, but they didn't fit our system. It would have been nice to know that before we ordered them. Have sent them back, but still have not received our money back yet.
customer_reviews.author: sminnich

product_meta.title: RCA 25214 na 1-Handset 2-Line Landline Telephone
product_meta.description: Model Number: 25214 is a stand alone 2 line corded telephone system that supports your home/office needs. it features a Voicemail Waiting Indicator, Call Waiting Caller ID with 99 Name/Number Log, Full-Duplex Speakerphone, 10 Programmable One-Touch Speed Dials, 99 Name/Number Directory, Easy-to-read backlit LCD display, 2-Line Conferencing, Do Not Disturb/Privacy Setting, Headset Jack, the display can be switched from English to Spanish or French, Digital Volume Control, can be Desk or Wall Mounted, Hearing Aid Compatible and a 2 Year Warranty For customer service assistance, dial 1.800.511.3180
feature_bullets: Call Waiting Caller ID with 99 Name/Number Log

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars73 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
